title: How to Block Coreldraw from the Internet

steps.title: Open Windows Defender Firewall with Advanced Security.
steps.content: Open Windows Defender Firewall with Advanced Security. The easiest way to open this app is to search "Firewall" in the Start menu (press the Win key on your keyboard and type "Firewall," which will initiate a search and display search results in your Start menu). [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source Open the search result displayed as "Windows Defender Firewall with Advanced Security" under the Apps header. If you're not using an account with administrative permissions, you may be prompted for a password before you can continue.

steps.title: Click Outbound Rules.
steps.content: Click Outbound Rules . It's in the vertical menu in the panel on the left side of the window with Inbound Rules and Monitoring . [2] X Research source

steps.title: Click New Rule.
steps.content: Click New Rule . It's in the panel on the right side of the window with the header, "Actions." [3] X Research source

steps.title: Select Program.
steps.content: Select Program . Since you want to block a CorelDRAW from accessing the Internet, make sure you select "Program" from the list. Click Next .

steps.title: Click the Browse button.
steps.content: Click the Browse button. This will open a new File Explorer window and allow you to select the program you want to block. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Double-click CorelDRW.exe.
steps.content: Double-click CorelDRW.exe . It's usually in the "Program Files" folder in your file manager (it might be labeled "Program Files" or "Program Files (x86)," depending on your version). Click Next .

steps.title: Select Block the connection.
steps.content: Select Block the connection . The circle next to the option will fill to indicate that it has been selected. [5] X Research source Click Next .

steps.title: Make sure all options are checked.
steps.content: Make sure all options are checked. Check that all three of the Domain, Private, and Public options here are checked to block the program from the internet in all networks. By default, all these options should have a check mark next to them. [6] X Research source Click Next .

steps.title: Enter a name for your new rule and click Finish.
steps.content: Enter a name for your new rule and click Finish . Your new Internet block will be saved to your firewall as a new rule. Make sure to enter a name you will recognize on your rules list here, like "Block Corel Connection." [7] X Research source
